function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The generated code is missing the functionality to create and retrieve posts. The original task required the API to have endpoints for creating and retrieving posts. This functionality can be added by creating new routes in the Flask application for handling POST and GET requests for posts.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The JWT token encoding in the login function is returning a string, but the code is trying to decode it as if it were bytes. This is causing an AttributeError. The token does not need to be decoded after being encoded. The encoded token can be returned directly.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The current implementation uses a simple in-memory data structure (dictionary) to store users and posts. This means that all data will be lost when the server is restarted. A more robust solution would be to use a database to persist the data. This could be a simple file-based database like SQLite, or a more complex solution like PostgreSQL or MongoDB, depending on the needs of the application.
